result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven P. Chapple was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant must execute the Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and file it with the Clerk of Circuit Court no later than May 5, 2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Steven P. Chapple
Current: W7537 S. County Road A, Wild Rose, WI 54984 United States  (Effective: 03-14-2016)
Prior: W7537 S County Road A; PO Box 247, Wild Rose, WI 54984

Case Called @ 10:48 AM: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zamzow appears via Atty Authorization.  ADA recites resolution.  Atty Zamzow agrees with recital and affirms discussions with her client.  Plea QN provided with tender of NC plea.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Factual basis supporting offense alleged.  Allocution recited - steps being taken on transportation issues.  Court imposes Court Costs only w/DNA surcharge - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given - to be executed and provided back to the Court within one week.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

11:31 am case called. Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Attorney Zamzow appears with Authorization-Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given. Bond to be signed and returned no later than April 10, 2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Quashed by the Court pursuant to Atty Zamzow's 3/25/2015 Letter
from Atty Zamzow Dated 3/25/2015 Re: Request to Quash Warrant - Request granted by the Court.

Case Called @ 3:36 PM: Defendant Steven P. Chapple not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and makes a finding of probable cause as alleged in Count No. 1.  Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.  Court orders $250 cash bond posted is now revoked.
